page.title: 20Health in Inverbervie Area
page.content: The health of the people in our area is looked after by{three doctors, four {nurses and two health visitors.}Their base is at the Health Centre, Kirkburn, Inverbervie, formerly an old school. The doctors hold daily surgeries seeing on average fifty people each day. They also make roughly twenty house calls per day. The nurses' duties include doing dressings, giving injections, assisting doctors and visiting the elderly while the health visitors look after the pre-school children. As well as antenatal, child assessment and "well baby" clinics, we can have treatment from the Chiropodist, advice from a dietician and physiotherapy, the last being financed by a trust so only those resident in Inverbervie get this treatment free. Our nearest hospitals are in Aberdeen and Brechin.
